title: Harmony Hall: Park Home
body: Harmony Hall  The 18th century Harmony Hall mansion is located on a 62.5-acre open pasture land estate along the Potomac River.Â  This estate was purchased by the National Park Service in 1966, to preserve southern Maryland cultural heritage. Surrounded by a rich landscape, it offers visitors many chances to connect with Colonial History. The park also home to the remains of the Want Water House and canal.              Harmony Hall History   Harmony Hall has one of the oldest structures in Prince Georges County within its boundaries...Want Water.
